title: cmd/gc: compound if statement changes NIL values
body:
by **MihaiBorobocea**: 
1. What is a short input program that triggers the error?
http://play.golang.org/p/PHsbWqt9L-

2. What is the full compiler output?
The compound if statement breaks all "!= nil" checks.
This happens when a function returns a pointer and a compound if statement assigns it to
a variable of interface type: interface{}, error, etc.

3. What version of the compiler are you using?  (Run it with the -V flag.)
go version go1.3 linux/amd64
